I have installed a GTK2, the folder (/usr/lib) is inserted in the ld.so.conf
the file libpangoxft-1.0.so.0 exists in the folder.

Regards, Martin

Removed dependency on gtkxft.
Please tell us if this fixed the problem.

Two comments.
(1) looking at the error, FT_Get_First_Char is referenced *from libpangoxft*. 
That means that libpangoxft itself can't be properly loaded.  You can verify
this by saying
ldd -r /usr/lib/libpangoxft-1.0.so.0
If my underestanding of your situation is right, ldd should complain.

(2) In the latest Eclipse build, we have removed any references to libpangoxft.
 So it's referenced from somewhere inside your GTK.  Try ldd -r against
libswt-pi to see how libpangoxft got in, and let me know.

I think, thats correct, what you wrote.
Here the output for the ldd-command.

My eclipse do now running (thanks Frank's posting in the dclj-newsgroup).
It was a incorrect (another versions of the rpm-packages) installation of gtk2.
Here the list and the order of the rpm-packages, which are must installed, thats
eclipse start without problems.

atk-1.0.1-1gtk.i386.rpm
glib2-2.0.1-1gtk.i386.rpm
freetype-2.0.9-2gtk.i386.rpm
pango-1.0.1-1gtk.i386.rpm
pkgconfig-0.12.0-1gtk.i386.rpm
gtk2-2.0.1-1gtk.i386.rpm

The installation of the rpm freetype make trouble, the options "overwrite files"
is needed to overwrite older files.
Thanks for your help and IMHO you can close this bug.
I am glad this is finally resolved.
